The Great Game | image = [[File:Boyuk23.jpg|250px|Neftchi fans during a game between the two clubs.]] | other names = Neftchi Baku vs Khazar Lankaran | city or region = [[Baku]] / [[Lankaran]], [[Azerbaijan]] | first contested = 8 December 2004 | teams involved = [[Neftchi Baku PFC|Neftchi Baku]]
[[Khazar Lankaran]] | most wins = [[Neftchi Baku PFC|Neftchi Baku]] (7) | most player appearances = | mostrecent = [[Neftchi Baku PFC|Neftchi Baku]] 5-0 [[Khazar Lankaran]] (5 November 2011) }} '''BÃ¶yÃ¼k Oyun''' ([[English Language|English]]: "The Great Game") is an [[Azerbaijani people|Azerbaijani]] [[Association football|football]] [[Major football rivalries|rivalry]] involving two of the most successful clubs in [[Azerbaijan]]. The fixture has developed into an intense and often bitter one, traditionally attracting large attendances.{{cite news|title=Ð Ð°ÑÐ°Ð´ ÐÐ±Ð´ÑÐ»Ð»Ð°ÐµÐ² Ð¿ÐµÑÐµÑÐµÐ» Ð² "ÐÐµÑÑÑÐ¸" {{ru icon}}|url=http://www.zerkalo.az/2009-07-01/sports/309-|work=Zerkalo.az|date=2009-07-01|accessdate=2009-02-16}}[http://ru.apasport.az/news.php?id=53606 Ð¢Ð¸ÑÐ¾Ð½ Ð¨Ð¸ÑÐ¾Ð²: ÐÑÐ»Ð¸ Ñ Ð·Ð°Ð²Ð¾ÑÑ ÑÐ¸ÑÑÐ» Ñ Â«Ð¥Ð°Ð·Ð°Ñ-ÐÑÐ½ÐºÑÑÐ°Ð½Ð¾Ð¼Â»] {{ru icon}} The tie has been played out at numerous venues across the cities, with [[Lankaran City Stadium]] being the stadium most synonymous with the fixture, having hosted more games than any other. ==History== === Cultural rivalry ===
{{Location map+|Azerbaijan|width=300|float=right|caption=Locations of the two teams|places= {{Location map~|Azerbaijan|lat=40.4 |long=49.9 |label=[[PFC Neftchi Baku|Neftchi Baku]] }} {{Location map~|Azerbaijan|lat=38.7536 |long=48.87111 |label=[[FK Khazar Lankaran|Khazar Lankaran]] }} }}
The clubs have large support bases around Baku, but also have supporters clubs in most towns throughout Azerbaijan. The relationship between the two clubs has always been known for its great animosity, as the classic opposes two geographic regions - with Neftchi and Khazar Lankaran representing the north and south of Azerbaijan, respectively.[http://www.extratime.az/article.php?aid=5522 Ð Ð°Ð¸Ð»Ñ ÐÐÐÐÐÐÐ: Â«Ð­ÑÐ¾ Ð³Ð»Ð°Ð²Ð½Ð¾Ðµ Ð´ÐµÑÐ±Ð¸ ÐÐ·ÐµÑÐ±Ð°Ð¹Ð´Ð¶Ð°Ð½Ð° Ð¸ ÐµÐ³Ð¾ Ð½ÐµÐ²Ð¾Ð·Ð¼Ð¾Ð¶Ð½Ð¾ ÑÑÐ°Ð²Ð½Ð¸ÑÑ Ñ Ð´ÑÑÐ³Ð¸Ð¼ Ð¼Ð°ÑÑÐµÐ¼Â»] {{ru icon}}[http://pfl.az/content.php?lang=az&page=14&nid=110 50 saat qalmÄ±Å] {{az icon}}[http://deyerler.org/texts/news/idman/26641-adasjjlim-mircavadov-vneftgiv-vxjjzjjr.html AÄasÉlim Mircavadov :âNeftÃ§iâ - âXÉzÉr-LÉnkÉranâ matÃ§Ä± azarkeÅlÉrÉ xoÅ tÉsir baÄÄ±ÅladÄ±."] {{az icon}} === Football rivalry === The first game played between the two sides was a [[Azerbaijan Premier League]] fixture on Wednesday, 8 December 2004. The game, staged at Lankaran City stadium, finished 1-1 draw.[http://fanat.az/?mod=view&id=15334 Derbini indiydÉk neÃ§É azarkeÅ izlÉyib?] {{az icon}} Both clubs compete each other for the title of the most successful football club in the country. ==== The Great Game Marathon ==== In 2011, the derby reached its ultimate peak as both clubs had to play each other 4 times during 33 days, after [[2010â11 Azerbaijan Cup|Azerbaijan Cup]] draws and Azerbaijan Premier League format changes.{{cite web|title=ÐÐ°ÑÐ°ÑÐ¾Ð½ ÐÐ¾Ð»ÑÑÐ¾Ð¹ ÐÐ³ÑÑ: ÑÐµÑÑÑÐµ Ð¼Ð°ÑÑÐ° Ð·Ð° 33 Ð´Ð½Ñ|url=http://www.azerisport.com/football/20110206122808801.html|publisher=Azerisport.com|accessdate=6 February 2011}}{{cite web|title=Ramin Musayev: "Milli komandanÄ± nÉzÉrÉ almalÄ±yÄ±q"|url=http://qol.az/new/?name=xeber&news_id=18878|publisher=Qol.az|accessdate=6 February 2011}} Khazar became triumphant over Neftchi, even though all other remaining games ended in draw.{{cite web|title=Ð¥Ð°Ð·Ð°Ñ ÑÐ¿Ð°ÑÑÑ Ð¾Ñ Ð¿Ð¾Ð·Ð¾ÑÐ° Ð½Ð° ÑÐ¾Ð´Ð½Ð¾Ð¼ Ð¿Ð¾Ð»Ðµ|url=http://azerifootball.com/ru/9/news/5163.html|publisher=Azerifootball.com|accessdate=18 March 2011}} ==== Unbeaten series of Khazar Lankaran ==== Khazar Lankaran has the longest unbeaten series in Great Games. Last time Lankaran side lost to Neftchi on 12th of April, 2009 (2:1). After that date 11 games have been played between both teams in all competitions. In three of last eleven encounters Khazar Lankaran beat their rival and other matches finished with draw. On 6 November 2011, Neftchi broke Khazar's 938 days of unbeaten run and recorded the biggest win in derby, by beating Khazar 5-0 in Baku.{{cite web|title=Â«NeftÃ§iÂ»nin intiqamÄ± aÄÄ±r oldu|url=http://fanat.az/?mod=view&id=34242|work=fanat.az|accessdate=6 November 2011|language=Azerbaijani}} === Supporters rivalry === [[File:Firtina face.jpg|thumb|right|Khazar Lankaran fans]] The rivalry turned bitter after Neftchi won [[Azerbaijan Premier League]] title by beating Khazar Lankaran in play off match. Over time, the rivalry became more heated and club fans began attaining collective identities. Neftchi was seen as a capital club, while Khazar was viewed as regional club and supported by the south regions of Azerbaijani society.[http://www.football-plus.az/view_post.php?id=1116 Paytaxt tÉmsilÃ§ilÉrinin manevr ÅansÄ± qalÄ±bmÄ±?] {{az icon}}[http://azerisport.com/articles.php?item_id=20100217120539488&sec_id=2 Ð¢ÑÐ¸Ð½Ð°Ð´ÑÐ°ÑÐ¾Ðµ Ð¿ÑÐ¾ÑÐ¸Ð²Ð¾ÑÑÐ¾ÑÐ½Ð¸Ðµ] {{ru icon}} Crowd attendances for first 21 games, has exceeded 229,000 supporters.{{cite web|title=Â«BÃ¶yÃ¼k oyunÂ»: DerbidÉ azarkeÅ sayÄ±|url=http://fanat.az/?mod=view&id=32626|work=fanat.az|accessdate=8 September 2011|language=Azerbaijani}} Because of the sensitive nature of the matches, [[Football hooliganism|fan violence]] has occurred several times. In minor cases fans break chairs or throw garbage at the field, but more notable cases of violence have involved physical fights between opposing teams and fans, storming of the field by fans, as well as significant destruction of public property.[http://www.musavat.com/site/shownews.php?news_id=41611&arxiv=yes Bu oyun zamanÄ± stadiona cÉmi 174 polis ÉmÉkdaÅÄ± nÉzarÉt edÉcÉk ] {{az icon}} Both team supporters also keep on their rivalry in creativeness. Almost at the each game Khazar Lankaran and Neftchi fans demonstrate each other different banners with astute phrases. [http://fanat.az/index.php?mod=view&id=26523 Â«BÃ¶yÃ¼k oyunÂ»: Â«Bu oyunu bÃ¶yÃ¼k edÉn bizikÂ» - FOTOLAR ] {{az icon}} ==Head to head record== {|class="wikitable" style="text-align:center" !Competition !width=60|Played !width=60|Neftchi Baku !width=60|Draw !width=60|Khazar Lankaran |- |align=left|[[Azerbaijan Premier League]] |21 |7 |9 |6 |- |align=left|[[Azerbaijan Cup]] |2 |0 |1 |1 |- |-class="sortbottom" !align=left|Totals |23 |7 |10 |7 |} Note: League championship statistics includes play-off match for the 2004–05 title, which Neftchi won 2–1. 2004–2011 statistics obtained from [http://uk.soccerway.com/national/azerbaijan/supreme-league/2009-2010/regular-season/ Soccerway.com]. Remaining stats obtained from [http://fanat.az/?mod=view&id=15334 Fanat.az] ==Switching sides== (In '''bold''': Transfer between both clubs) ===Players=== Transfers between both clubs are rare, only few in last decade. *{{flagicon|AZE}} [[Mahmud Qurbanov]] (Neftchi 1996 - 1997/ 2004 - 2005, Khazar Lankaran 2005 - 2007) *{{flagicon|AZE}} [[Rashad Abdullayev]] (Khazar Lankaran 2004 - 2009, Neftchi 2009 - ) *{{flagicon|AZE}} [[Branimir SubaÅ¡iÄ]] (Neftchi 2005 - 2008, Khazar Lankaran 2011 - ) ===Managers=== *{{flagicon|AZE}} [[Agaselim Mirjavadov]] (Neftchi 1987 - 1988/2004-2006, Khazar Lankaran 2006-2010) ==See also== *[[Neftchi Baku PFC|Neftchi Baku]] *[[Khazar Lankaran]] *[[Major football rivalries]] == References == {{reflist|2}} ==External links== *[http://www.neftci.az/ Neftchi Baku Official website] {{az icon}} *[http://www.lankaranfc.com/ Khazar Lankaran Official website] {{az icon}}, {{en icon}}, {{ru icon}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Boyuk Oyun}} [[Category:Azerbaijan Premier League]] [[Category:Association football rivalries]] [[Category:Football in Azerbaijan]] [[Category:Neftchi Baku PFC]] [[Category:FK Khazar Lankaran]] [[az:BÃ¶yÃ¼k Oyun]]
